title: ‘Large operation’ underway after fatal shooting at German church, police say
description: A shooting at a church in Hamburg, Germany, left several people seriously injured, “some even fatally,” Hamburg police said Thursday.

title: Mexican cartel delivers ‘kidnappers’ — five bound men — and an apology
description: The action appeared to follow the Mexican cartel tradition of handing over members who have have caused them problems.

title: Germany: Deaths, injuries in shooting inside Hamburg church
description: German police say that shots were fired inside a church in the northern city of Hamburg on Thursday night and that an unspecified number of people were killed and seriously wounded

title: A. Eugene Kohn, whose architecture firm reached for the sky, dies at 92
description: He was a founder of KPF, which designed four of the 10 tallest buildings in the world. He also designed the World Bank headquarters in Washington.

title: Police: Extremists kill 25 fishermen in northeast Nigeria
description: Local authorities say that Islamic extremist rebels have killed 25 fishermen in an attack in northeastern Nigeria’s Borno state

title: Mexican president to US: Fentanyl is your problem
description: Mexico’s president has said his country does not produce or consume fentanyl, despite enormous evidence to the contrary

title: France: About 200 church sex abuse victims get compensation
description: The French Independent National Authority for Recognition and Reparation says 190 victims of child abuse by priests or other church representatives have seen financial compensation ordered by an independent body, under a reparation process launched last year

title: US defense chief's visit to Israel reveals divisions on Iran
description: Long-running differences between the Biden administration and Israel over how to stop Iran’s rapidly accelerating nuclear program have spilled into public view

title: What we know, and still don’t know, about the missing MH370 plane
description: Netflix just released a new series: “MH370 The Plane That Disappeared,“ renewing interest in one of the biggest aviation mysteries of all time.

title: ‘Zombie’ viruses are thawing in melting permafrost because of climate change
description: 'Zombie' viruses are buried in the Arctic permafrost. European researchers warn they may increasingly be unleashed as global warming thaws it.

title: Mexican gang said to apologize over deaths of Americans
description: Someone claiming to be the Mexican drug cartel allegedly responsible for the abduction of four Americans – two of whom died – has condemned the violence and purportedly turned over its own members who were involved to authorities

title: German police nab man suspected of planning Frankfurt attack
description: German investigators say an 18-year-old man suspected of having planned an extremist attack in Frankfurt has been arrested near Germany’s border with Austria

title: Topol, Israeli actor who starred in film ‘Fiddler on the Roof,’ dies at 87
description: Literally aging into the role, Topol played the part more than 3,500 times on stage, most recently in 2009.

title: What you need to know about Russia’s hypersonic missiles
description: Such missiles, in use against Ukraine, travel faster than five times the speed of sound and are difficult for air defense systems to detect.

title: Contentious German church reform assembly opens last meeting
description: Germany’s Catholic bishops and lay representatives have gathered for the final meeting of a potentially groundbreaking reform assembly that has been marked by tensions between liberalizers and conservatives

title: Wreckage of Philippine plane found with all 6 aboard dead
description: A Philippine search team guided by sniffer dogs has found the wreckage of a single-engine plane that crashed on a mountain more than a month ago and confirmed that all six people on board were dead

title: France moves to put abortion rights in constitution as U.S. curbs access
description: French President Emmanuel Macron says enshrining abortion in the constitution would show solidarity with "all women who today see this right violated."

title: Israel's Netanyahu flies to Rome as Meloni condemns swastika
description: Far-right Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni is condemning antisemitic graffiti directed at her main rival

title: 14 dead, 54 rescued off Tunisia in migrant boat sinking
description: The Tunisian National Guard says at least 14 Africans died and 54 were rescued when a boat in which they were trying to reach Europe sank off the coast of Tunisia

title: At least 36 people killed by extremists in eastern Congo
description: Congo’s military said Thursday at least 36 people were killed by extremists in the country’s conflict-riddled east

title: Nigeria bus crashes into train; 6 dead and dozens injured
description: Six people were killed and dozens injured when a train crashed into a passenger bus in Lagos, Nigeria

title: Fear, anxiety follow Nicaraguan faith leaders into exile
description: Dozens of priests, nuns, seminarians and church workers have fled Nicaragua in recent years, or been exiled by President Daniel Ortega’s government, which considers them a threat

title: In photos: At least 5 dead after ‘massive’ strikes across Ukraine
description: Russia launched attacks across the country, including in the capital, Kyiv. Five people were killed in Lviv, and Kharkiv was hit 15 times, authorities said.

title: Israel’s military joins nationwide protests over judicial overhaul
description: Netanyahu's planned judicial overhaul has so divided society that some soldiers are contemplating refusing to serve in the reserves on which Israel’s relatively tiny army relies.

title: Russia fires barrage of hypersonic missiles, piercing Ukrainian air defenses
description: Russia resumed its brutal airstrikes on Ukraine, hitting at least 10 regions with a mix of weapons including missiles that travel faster than sound and cannot be detected by air defenses

title: German woman risks tougher sentence over Yazidi girl's death
description: A German appeals court has ordered a new sentencing hearing for a German convert to Islam who was given 10 years in prison on charges that as a member of the Islamic State group in Iraq she allowed a 5-year-old Yazidi girl she and her husband kept as a slave to die of thirst in the sun

title: A tanker sank and spilled oil. Then came reports of nausea, headaches.
description: Residents in Oriental Mindoro, Philippines, reported symptoms of illness after the MT Princess Empress tanker sank and caused a major oil spill.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile toward sea, Seoul says
description: South Korea’s military says it has detected that North Korea fired a short-range ballistic missile toward waters off its western coast

title: Mexico kidnappings put a spotlight on medical tourism
description: The attack in Matamoros has not appeared to deter American patients seeking medical procedures in Mexico.

title: Taliban governor of Afghan province killed in bomb blast
description: Muhammad Dawood Muzamil is one of the highest-ranked Taliban officials killed since the group took over the country in August 2021.

title: 34 years ago, another American’s kidnapping in Matamoros ended in tragedy
description: The kidnapping of four Americans in Mexico brings back memories of the 1989 cult kidnapping and slaying of Texas college student Mark Kilroy and others.

title: Egypt's inflation spikes again, hiking prices of basic food
description: Egypt says inflation in the country has hit a new high this year, with the steepest price rises for basic foods

title: Pakistani police probe officers over women’s march violence
description: Pakistani police say they are investigating officers after violence at a women’s march in the capital, Islamabad

title: 6 books compete for nonfiction 'winner of winners' prize
description: Books that explore subjects from William Shakespeare and The Beatles to the lure of Mount Everest and life inside one of the world’s most secretive states are competing to be named the best-ever winner of Britain’s leading nonfiction book prize

title: France's young people stand up against higher retirement age
description: Young people in France are protesting against the government’s push to raise the retirement age

title: Satellite photos: Likely Israel strike damages Syria airport
description: A suspected Israeli airstrike targeting Aleppo International Airport in Syria again has torn multiple craters on its runway

title: Israelis stage 'day of resistance' against Netanyahu plan
description: Israeli protesters were intensifying their opposition to a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: Bomb kills 3, including provincial governor, in Afghanistan
description: Police say a Taliban-appointed provincial governor and two others have been killed in a bomb explosion

title: Georgia withdraws Russian-style foreign influence bill after protests
description: The thousands of protestors who descended on the streets of capital Tbilisi likened the bill to a decades-old law in Russia used to target critics and dissenting voices.

title: Internet outage has Taiwan worried about threat from Chinese sabotage
description: Taiwan's Matsu islands have been without internet since Chinese boats took out undersea cables a month ago. What if the next time isn’t an accident?

title: Why is Indonesia moving its capital from Jakarta to Borneo?
description: Indonesian government authorities unveiled the site of the country’s new capital this week, showing a preview of what progress has been made on the city’s construction

title: Indonesia unveils construction site of new capital city
description: Orange-red ground has been broken in the jungle of East Borneo, where the Indonesian government has begun construction of its new capital city

title: Ukraine live briefing: Widespread missile attacks target cities across Ukraine
description: The barrage included 15 missile strikes in the Kharkiv region, its governor said, as air raid warnings spread across the country. Alarms blared for hours in Kyiv.

title: Chaim Topol, Israeli actor known for Fiddler's Tevye, dies
description: Israeli leaders say the award-winning Israeli actor known for portraying Tevye in Fiddler on the Roof has died in Tel Aviv

title: To see Russia’s secret antiwar art: Meet at a bus stop. At dark. Phones off.
description: To display art that opposes the war in Ukraine, and avoid arrest, Russian artists have gone underground, creating a secret exhibit in a return to Soviet-era stealth.

title: At least 3 Palestinians killed in Israeli military raid
description: Palestinian officials say at least three Palestinians have were killed after Israeli security forces entered a village in the northern occupied West Bank

title: UN renews Sudan arms embargo as Russia and China abstain
description: The U.N. Security Council has approved a resolution renewing an arms embargo and other sanctions imposed over violence in Sudan’s western Darfur region that began in 2004

title: Nord Stream intrigue raises tricky questions for Kyiv
description: Whether involved or not, Kyiv has good reason to be cautious about the intrigue, which comes as it continues its push for new support and weapons.
